intro: Disporum luzoniense, commonly known as Luzon disporum, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its clustered, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
